Egypt, added the statement, recognized and appreciated the care accorded by Germany to the painted limestone bust of the famous ancient Egyptian queen, but added: Egypt is confident that the German authorities will assist in facilitating its return. The government and people of Egypt are eager that this unique treasure be returned to the possession of its rightful owners, the Egyptian people. If returned, Zahi Hawass said, the bust will be exhibited at a new museum south of Cairo.

In my clear opinion, Larry is ready to lead and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come, he said in the statement. Eric Schmidt summed up the seismic shift at Google's helm in a Twitter post last week that said, Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed! Eric Schmidt has led Google since 2001, three years before the company went public. Since then, Google's shares have grown more than sixfold, at one point surpassing$ 700. by incoherent decision-making and policy drift, and a detriment to the war effort, the Post said. Donald Rumsfeld suggests Bush was at fault for not doing more to resolve disagreements among senior advisers. The president did not always receive, and may not have insisted on, a timely consideration of his options before he made a decision, nor did he always receive effective implementation of the decisions he made, Donald Rumsfeld wrote. Addressing charges that he failed to provide enough troops for the Iraq war, he wrote: "In retrospect, there may have been times when more troops could have helped."
